DMV.definition: The economy is jih lunchin and a lot of people are blown.
Companies that have been making money for a brick.
When the economy is it’s bag. Particularly the stock market.
The difference of what you copped an asset for and what you sold for it.
Deadass when a company pays its profits to its investor
Not investing all your money off rip, but putting in little by little at a time.
Whole time, just a another word for “stocks”.
You cop some ownership of a company.
What bammas buy when they want more money without doing more work.
The things you buy to look cool but jah like makes someone else rich. And you deadass broke.
When you try to borrow money from a bank without paying any interest or other fees, the bank’s like “On who?”
When you leave your money in a savings account and whole time the bank pays you.
Money tucked away for when your life starts poppin off
Real live measures the performance of a market or sector
Deadass tracks and copies the performance of a market or sector
When your dollar tries to go smack at the grocery store and it leaves sick ‘cause it can’t buy as much as it did a year ago
Jih the money you pay for borrowing money or the money you’re paid for lending it.
Will it be slight to get cash from it or leave you guh
Not lookin’ for an easy lick but some tuff growth over time
The price of coppin a stock at the current moment

Standard.definition: Explains what a business does with its money
Benefits you tomorrow by buying it today
You owe! Don’t forget to pay up.
What the business owns, what the business owes and what the owners get to keep
Seeing all the money you made be chopped by the money you had to spend to make it.
How much skin in the game an investor has in a business
A world where money is made and expenses are a figment of your imagination.
Money spend to operate a business. Usually things you buy that will be used up in a year or less
A company could give its profit to you but instead will hoard it to itself.
Service/Work is completed but instead of being paid now, you’re paid later.
When work gets do for you but you pay those people later instead of now.
The money spent to directly make the products you sold. Think the ingredients needed to make a delicious cake.
A debit INCREASES assets and DECREASES liabilities & equity.
A credit INCREASES liabilities & equity and  DECREASES asset
